str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To stir up, incite, urge on. From para and otruno; to urge along, i.e. Stimulate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Feminine Plural
str2: To reverence, worship, adore. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to revere, i.e. Adore.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
From eu and schema; well-formed, i.e. decorous, noble.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To arouse, stimulate, excite against. From epi and egeiro; to rouse upon, i.e. to excite against.
Chase, pursuit; persecution. From dioko; persecution.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
And, even, also, namely.
Of Chaldee origin; son of Nabas; Barnabas, an Israelite.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Neuter of a derivative of an apparently primary horos; a boundary-line, i.e. a frontier.
